revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-10 16:59:45.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/agent.py', 'releasenotes/notes/agent-takeover-60f27cef21ebfb48.yaml', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/test_agent.py'], 'message': 'Fix take over of ACTIVE nodes in AgentDeploy

currently if the ACTIVE netboot-ed node with driver based on AgentDeploy
is being taken over by another conductor due to the whole host with
previous conductor died/went offline, the node will not be fully
operational as it cannot be rebooted from inside:

- its DHCP options are still pointing to the TFTP/HTTP servers of old
  (now offline) conductor host
- new conductor host does not have the user image kernel and ramdisk
  cached
- new conductor host lacks PXE env prepared for such node.

Fix this by actually calling out to `driver.boot.prepare_instance`
in AgentDeploy.prepare for ACTIVE nodes.

Change-Id: Ie21e285e22c6a8b168f8c9776a125f3bb71fead7
Closes-Bug: #1646038
'}]
commit_message:
Fix take over of ACTIVE nodes in AgentDeploy

currently if the ACTIVE netboot-ed node with driver based on AgentDeploy
is being taken over by another conductor due to the whole host with
previous conductor died/went offline, the node will not be fully
operational as it cannot be rebooted from inside:

- its DHCP options are still pointing to the TFTP/HTTP servers of old
  (now offline) conductor host
- new conductor host does not have the user image kernel and ramdisk
  cached
- new conductor host lacks PXE env prepared for such node.

Fix this by actually calling out to `driver.boot.prepare_instance`
in AgentDeploy.prepare for ACTIVE nodes.

Change-Id: Ie21e285e22c6a8b168f8c9776a125f3bb71fead7
Closes-Bug: #1646038

commit_message:
Enable no-Internet build for most Ubuntu binary containers

This set of changes adds a number of configuration options and
parameterizations where local repositories can be used instead of
repositories on the Internet for binary packages. Most commonly used
containers are covered by this changeset. Work is ongoing to extend this
to other distributions, as well as source builds.

Closes-Bug: #1633187
Related-Bug: #1653740
Change-Id: I692a205973abffb893b484b953ef45c992f43697

This commit replaces the actual repo configuration and overcloud

subrole is created under the main baremetal-undercloud one.
With this in place it is possible to follow this sequence:

- Provide and prepare the undercloud machine (role baremetal-undercloud)
- Inventory the newly created machine (role tripleo-inventory)
- Setup repositories (role repo-setup)
- Install and configure packages on undercloud (baremetal-undercloud's
  subrole named "packages"):
  - tripleo package
  - additional packages (optional)
  - ntp configuration (replaces what was done before in the custom
    template undercloud-repos-conf.sh.j2)
- Install the undercloud

A new review to update the documentation will be done after this gets
merged.

Change-Id: Iba11c4d61a63bb05016177abd16403168d82331b
'}]
commit_message:
Add external repo and img roles to bm undercloud

This commit replaces the actual repo configuration and overcloud
images preparation inclusions with the already existing external
dedicated roles (repo-setup and fetch-images).
To configure this the two playbooks are modified and a new "packages"
subrole is created under the main baremetal-undercloud one.
With this in place it is possible to follow this sequence:

- Provide and prepare the undercloud machine (role baremetal-undercloud)
- Inventory the newly created machine (role tripleo-inventory)
- Setup repositories (role repo-setup)
- Install and configure packages on undercloud (baremetal-undercloud's
  subrole named "packages"):
  - tripleo package
  - additional packages (optional)
  - ntp configuration (replaces what was done before in the custom
    template undercloud-repos-conf.sh.j2)
- Install the undercloud

A new review to update the documentation will be done after this gets
merged.

Change-Id: Iba11c4d61a63bb05016177abd16403168d82331b

In a new 1.3 microversion, the GET /resource_providers handler gains
support for a new query parameter 'member_of' which takes a value of
'in:' and a comma separated list of aggregate uuids, or a single
aggregate uuid.

The response is the list of resource providers that are associated
with any of those aggregates, or an empty list if there are none.

If in an old microversion, the query parameter is not accepted and a
400 is returned.

Change-Id: I82fc2003ce85dcadfecfea506e7d4adb47258c7a
"}]
commit_message:
HTTP interface for resource providers by aggregates

In a new 1.3 microversion, the GET /resource_providers handler gains
support for a new query parameter 'member_of' which takes a value of
'in:' and a comma separated list of aggregate uuids, or a single
aggregate uuid.

The response is the list of resource providers that are associated
with any of those aggregates, or an empty list if there are none.

If in an old microversion, the query parameter is not accepted and a
400 is returned.

Change-Id: I82fc2003ce85dcadfecfea506e7d4adb47258c7a

subject: Fail the validation workflows when sending a "FAILED" message
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-13 09:22:49.000000000', 'files': ['workbooks/validations.yaml'], 'message': 'Fail the validation workflows when sending a "FAILED" message

When Mistral workflows execute a second workflow (a sub-workflow
execution), the parent workflow can't easily determine if sub-workflow
failed.  This is because the failure is communicated via a Zaqar message
only and when a workflow ends with a successful Zaqar message it appears
have been successful. This problem surfaces because parent workflows
should have an "on-error" attribute but it is never called, as the
workflow doesn't error.

This change marks the workflow as failed if the message has the status
"FAILED". Now when a sub-workflow fails, the task that called it should
have the on-error triggered. Previously it would always go to
on-success.

Change-Id: I2170afac89e8261c1e2289da8e9220694fadbad0
Related-Bug: #1651704
'}]
commit_message:
Fail the validation workflows when sending a "FAILED" message

When Mistral workflows execute a second workflow (a sub-workflow
execution), the parent workflow can't easily determine if sub-workflow
failed.  This is because the failure is communicated via a Zaqar message
only and when a workflow ends with a successful Zaqar message it appears
have been successful. This problem surfaces because parent workflows
should have an "on-error" attribute but it is never called, as the
workflow doesn't error.

This change marks the workflow as failed if the message has the status
"FAILED". Now when a sub-workflow fails, the task that called it should
have the on-error triggered. Previously it would always go to
on-success.

Change-Id: I2170afac89e8261c1e2289da8e9220694fadbad0
Related-Bug: #1651704

commit_message:
Fail the plan_management workflows when sending a "FAILED" message

When Mistral workflows execute a second workflow (a sub-workflow
execution), the parent workflow can't easily determine if sub-workflow
failed.  This is because the failure is communicated via a Zaqar message
only and when a workflow ends with a successful Zaqar message it appears
have been successful. This problem surfaces because parent workflows
should have an "on-error" attribute but it is never called, as the
workflow doesn't error.

This change marks the workflow as failed if the message has the status
"FAILED". Now when a sub-workflow fails, the task that called it should
have the on-error triggered. Previously it would always go to
on-success.

Change-Id: Ie0f1d4e57505e9346ae3f0b25d755f55d73a255a
Related-Bug: #1651704

commit_message:
Fail the baremetal workflows when sending a "FAILED" message

When Mistral workflows execute a second workflow (a sub-workflow
execution), the parent workflow can't easily determine if sub-workflow
failed.  This is because the failure is communicated via a Zaqar message
only and when a workflow ends with a successful Zaqar message it appears
have been successful. This problem surfaces because parent workflows
should have an "on-error" attribute but it is never called, as the
workflow doesn't error.

This change marks the workflow as failed if the message has the status
"FAILED". Now when a sub-workflow fails, the task that called it should
have the on-error triggered. Previously it would always go to
on-success.

Closes-Bug: #1651704
Change-Id: I60444ec692351c44753649b59b7c1d7c4b61fa8e

commit_message:
Fix for failing kombu dsvm gate

Kombu gate is failing due to the fact, that API is multi-threaded
but is using same connection object. This change made kombu-client
object thread-safe.

Change-Id: Ie6f050c6effa01c0ebeb31194ab371f010b69ce0
Closes-bug: 1651997

commit_message:
Adjust the Gnocchi test to check for a 403

When unauthorized this should return a 403 and not a 401.
The upstream Gnocchi test for unauth checks a 403:

https://github.com/openstack/gnocchi/blob/master/gnocchi/tests/test_rest.py#L895

Change-Id: I42958d851e88d83f1f18b9311122f9f94dac36f4

commit_message:
Allow skipping manila tempest tests.

This commit allows to skip manila tempest tests when manila is set to
false in tempest.CONF service_available. This would allow to disable
manila testing in an environment where all the plugins are installed
(i.e. a package-based installation).

Change-Id: I75dd2fd86df7500ad0bc4f633ed39f7595e9dc8c

subject: add functional test for osc that uses master libraries
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-13 11:02:41.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/osc.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'add functional test for osc that uses master libraries

OpenStackClient uses a lot of other openstack libraries, we need
a job that installs these from master and is non-voting so we
can catch failures before they are out in the wild.

Related Patch: Ib6391893b2302bdc514525d5ddda886fe8c60100

The related patch is for adding the underlying structure to
openstackclient, I did not add a Depends-On since the job is
non-voting.

Change-Id: I557955621a66a4746a5923915d13f5d8078bd0e6
'}]
commit_message:
add functional test for osc that uses master libraries

OpenStackClient uses a lot of other openstack libraries, we need
a job that installs these from master and is non-voting so we
can catch failures before they are out in the wild.

Related Patch: Ib6391893b2302bdc514525d5ddda886fe8c60100

The related patch is for adding the underlying structure to
openstackclient, I did not add a Depends-On since the job is
non-voting.

Change-Id: I557955621a66a4746a5923915d13f5d8078bd0e6

commit_message:
Allow python-memcache install from authtoken class

The python-memcache package is required if using memcached. By
default the package is not installed and the define has it set to
false. This change allows managing the python-memcache package
install from the authtoken class.

Change-Id: I7aeccac5720adbaf7791ae9f782d223e9a2aaaf9

commit_message:
Require docker-py to be 1.8.1 or newer

We need the container_update API introduced in 1.8.0,
but 1.8.0 was blacklisted, so we require 1.8.1 or newer.

Change-Id: I588edc2383c6f71748232b5560607526f1fef2d4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-11 09:04:36.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/rbd.py'], 'message': "RBD: enable replication if needed.

The original code has method '_enable_replication_if_needed',
it first check that if the volume needs replication according to
its volume type, this is done in method '_is_replicated_type'.
If the volume type has field 'replication_enabled' and its value
is '<is> True', the method will return True. Then, it goes to the
method '_enable_replication'. However, when creating a volume type,
we always set the value of 'replication_enabled' to 'True' instead
of '<is> True', thus, the method '_is_replicated_type' will return
False, which means that the method '_enable_replication' will not
be executed.

Change-Id: I4b255ad124a7821d9604c0bcc69691b338b7dfe0
Close-Bug: #1655561
"}]
commit_message:
RBD: enable replication if needed.

The original code has method '_enable_replication_if_needed',
it first check that if the volume needs replication according to
its volume type, this is done in method '_is_replicated_type'.
If the volume type has field 'replication_enabled' and its value
is '<is> True', the method will return True. Then, it goes to the
method '_enable_replication'. However, when creating a volume type,
we always set the value of 'replication_enabled' to 'True' instead
of '<is> True', thus, the method '_is_replicated_type' will return
False, which means that the method '_enable_replication' will not
be executed.

Change-Id: I4b255ad124a7821d9604c0bcc69691b338b7dfe0
Close-Bug: #1655561

commit_message:
Formally deprecate the allow_port_security_disabled feature flag

Now that Liberty is EOL, the feature flag is not needed anymore. But
we still need to deprecate it in order to remove it later.

Change-Id: If0b2168080a0b0ecdc6682ef69856a0879f4f6d3

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-12 10:43:57.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/common_db_mixin.py'], 'message': 'Protect against non-determinstic sort

With the switch to subquery loading, we need to eliminate the
possibility for non-deterministic results in the event of LIMIT
queries caused by non-unique SORT BY parameters.

This always adds on a set of unique keys to sort by when sorting
params are present. By placing them at the end, they take the lower
priority over the user-provided sort strings.

1. http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/loading_relationships.html#subqueryload-ordering
2. http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/faq/ormconfiguration.html#faq-subqueryload-limit-sort

Change-Id: I5abb1c7e2710af0be9dbd757608574945a26637e
'}]
commit_message:
Protect against non-determinstic sort

With the switch to subquery loading, we need to eliminate the
possibility for non-deterministic results in the event of LIMIT
queries caused by non-unique SORT BY parameters.

This always adds on a set of unique keys to sort by when sorting
params are present. By placing them at the end, they take the lower
priority over the user-provided sort strings.

1. http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/orm/loading_relationships.html#subqueryload-ordering
2. http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/faq/ormconfiguration.html#faq-subqueryload-limit-sort

Change-Id: I5abb1c7e2710af0be9dbd757608574945a26637e

Add nova and neutron to major upgrade CI

This adds nova and neutron to the environment used for the upgrade
test, and some basic sanity tests to ensure they're running before
and after the upgrade.

commit_message:
Add DictOfMiscValuesField in OVO for dict usage

Add new field acting as full Pythonic dict equivalent for OVO.
Usage of DictOfStringField is not handling the case, when values should
be boolean, integer, float or list/dict.

Also use new field for Agent, PortBinding and DistributedPortBinding.

Change-Id: Iea3a6de89325401892b4e60ae1eb3a1d75b3ef31
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db

Change-Id: Ic7f8b89377e5b1317ac6e367aec5dfea58dcf1b3

commit_message:
Adapt neutron-ovn-db-sync-util to ml2 abbr.

When Configuring *core_plugin* with abbr *ml2* in neutron.conf,
neutron-ovn-db-sync-util considers it as invalid core plugin.

Change-Id: Ic7f8b89377e5b1317ac6e367aec5dfea58dcf1b3
Closes-Bug: #1655811
Signed-off-by: Dong Jun <dongj@dtdream.com>

Sphinx 1.5

The new sphinx version introduces some changes that break build:

* Warns if code cannot be parsed for highlighting. Fix the code so
  that it can be parsed, this includes uncommenting "..." lines.
  Note that not every config file is an ini-file.
  Also, the parser seems to have bugs and cannot parse all files.
  Fix mysql ini file and enable the parameter, see
http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/innodb-parameters.html#sysvar_innodb_file_per_table
* :option: works only with declared options, replace useage with
  simple ``.

This change only handles a few files, more to come later.

Change-Id: I7c7335e514581622dd562ee355f62d6ae1beaa18
'}]
commit_message:
Prepare for Sphinx 1.5

The new sphinx version introduces some changes that break build:

* Warns if code cannot be parsed for highlighting. Fix the code so
  that it can be parsed, this includes uncommenting "..." lines.
  Note that not every config file is an ini-file.
  Also, the parser seems to have bugs and cannot parse all files.
  Fix mysql ini file and enable the parameter, see
http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/innodb-parameters.html#sysvar_innodb_file_per_table
* :option: works only with declared options, replace useage with
  simple ``.

This change only handles a few files, more to come later.

Change-Id: I7c7335e514581622dd562ee355f62d6ae1beaa18

We need to differentiate local_working_dir from working_dir

Both of these are causing issues as we begin to automate
deployments in more environments.

- update common/defaults to use undercloud_user
- make tripleo-inventory inherit from common role, pull
  duplicate vars out of its defaults
- make convert-image inherit from common role, update
  template to use undercloud_user
- update libvirt/setup/undercloud to use undercloud_user

Change-Id: I45b0706df8351ff9ddc6c226989125dcb2f5b897

commit_message:
Integrate undercloud_user var int oooq

We need to differentiate local_working_dir from working_dir
as well as decouple the stack user from `ansible_user` var.
Both of these are causing issues as we begin to automate
deployments in more environments.

- update common/defaults to use undercloud_user
- make tripleo-inventory inherit from common role, pull
  duplicate vars out of its defaults
- make convert-image inherit from common role, update
  template to use undercloud_user
- update libvirt/setup/undercloud to use undercloud_user

Related-bug: 1654574

Change-Id: I45b0706df8351ff9ddc6c226989125dcb2f5b897

commit_message:
Use full path for heat template

Currently this will fail if the ansible user is modified, since the
command may be run from a different directory, so the heat template
won't be in $PWD.

Change-Id: I4f44e44f18c11a29b18b271f51fe68e5557353a5

commit_message:
Fix naming of reset tasks and message duplication

* reset_environment supertask contains 3 subtasks:
  base_reset_environment, remove_keys_task,
  remove_ironic_bootstrap_task
* names for tasks were changed
* response methods for remove_keys_task and
  remove_ironic_bootstrap_task were added to receiver
* _restore_pending_changes method was add only for
  reset_environment_resp
* migration for adding new transaction names and appropriate
  test were added
* test for check task message was added

Change-Id: Ib8a215174431486316bca533797932e02969c037
Closes-Bug: #1541868

commit_message:
Configure webpack to stop on error

When building the project, we want webpack to die with an exit code
other than 0.  Otherwise, we risk masking and silently ignoring errors.

Change-Id: Ic501effd3e9b21c785c09fc1ca189c8444b05f3c
Closes-bug: 1654051
(cherry picked from commit 3c5bcbb0f7069345c50bffe9094689f2fa4bc256)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-11 07:33:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/scheduler/filter_scheduler.py'], 'message': "Create volume based on volume type with 'replication_enabled=Ture' seccessfully.

I create a volume type named 'mirror' and set the value of type-key
'replication_enabled' to 'True'. Then I create a volume based on this
type but get an error from scheduler: No valid backend was found. No
weighed backends available. I view the source code, find that the type
of 'replication_enabled' passed to method '_satisfies_extra_specs' of
class  'CapabilitiesFilter' does not match with the type it's expected.

I change the value of 'replication_enabled' from 'True' to '<is> True',
then I can create volume based on this volume type seccessfully.

Change-Id: I08cd4b91c5bdafed62178240c85f00b8894ad5ba
Close-Bug: #1653904
"}]
commit_message:
Create volume based on volume type with 'replication_enabled=Ture' seccessfully.

I create a volume type named 'mirror' and set the value of type-key
'replication_enabled' to 'True'. Then I create a volume based on this
type but get an error from scheduler: No valid backend was found. No
weighed backends available. I view the source code, find that the type
of 'replication_enabled' passed to method '_satisfies_extra_specs' of
class  'CapabilitiesFilter' does not match with the type it's expected.

I change the value of 'replication_enabled' from 'True' to '<is> True',
then I can create volume based on this volume type seccessfully.

Change-Id: I08cd4b91c5bdafed62178240c85f00b8894ad5ba
Close-Bug: #1653904

commit_message:
Enable nailgun debug mode after fuel installation

For now "DEBUG: true" does not affects nailgun's development mode
which makes harded to debug backend errors like 400. Enabling debug allow
us to see hidden errors.

By default, VMs will be saved by Hyper-V when the host is shut down.
This adds some disk overhead, which may be undesirable.

For this reason, 'update_vm' accepts a new argument called

Change-Id: I68490a4e257eef88bdd07f3ec14d345a2df79a4a

commit_message:
Allow setting automatic vm shutdown action

By default, VMs will be saved by Hyper-V when the host is shut down.
This adds some disk overhead, which may be undesirable.

For this reason, 'update_vm' accepts a new argument called
'host_shudown_action', which allows changing this behavior.

Change-Id: I68490a4e257eef88bdd07f3ec14d345a2df79a4a

commit_message:
neutron: disable dvr tests for linuxbridge-scenario job

Linuxbridge so far does not support DVR. Use the new gate_hook 2nd
argument to disable tests for the feature.

Change-Id: I0e94c5d7f65bbb1d803df0d2f99389ae19556480

revisions:

  and enables gate-tempest-dsvm-nova-os-vif-ubuntu-xenial-nv.

  tested for compatibility with nova before they are merged.

commit_message:
adds experimental os-vif tempest gate

- This change creates an experimental pipeline for os-vif
  and enables gate-tempest-dsvm-nova-os-vif-ubuntu-xenial-nv.
- This change will allow changes proposed to os-vif to be
  tested for compatibility with nova before they are merged.
- This change will allow the
  gate-tempest-dsvm-nova-os-vif-ubuntu-xenial-nv job to be tested
  before enabling it in the check pipeline.

Change-Id: I7ab976d9a651845a376f77185a675ef79f3878c2

subject: Layout: make gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph non-voting
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-12 09:38:27.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Layout: make gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph non-voting

That job is not stable anymore.

On project openstack/tempest: for the
last 25 times where gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial
ran AND jenkins left a 'Verified -2' message, the job failed 14 times
and succeeded 11 times.

On project openstack/nova: For the
last 58 times where gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial
ran AND jenkins left a 'Verified -2' message, the job failed 48 times
and succeeded 10 times.

See the ML thread '[QA][Nova]Making
gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial non voting'
for further details.

Change-Id: I34406a4d5e09d4d6d712764c278cecc159e596e3
"}]
commit_message:
Layout: make gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph non-voting

That job is not stable anymore.

On project openstack/tempest: for the
last 25 times where gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial
ran AND jenkins left a 'Verified -2' message, the job failed 14 times
and succeeded 11 times.

On project openstack/nova: For the
last 58 times where gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial
ran AND jenkins left a 'Verified -2' message, the job failed 48 times
and succeeded 10 times.

See the ML thread '[QA][Nova]Making
gate-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-ceph-ubuntu-xenial non voting'
for further details.

Change-Id: I34406a4d5e09d4d6d712764c278cecc159e596e3

commit_message:
OpenStack configuration format has changed.

It's allowed to post changes to any part of deployment data instead of
updating data in configuration hash only

Change-Id: Ia0ea4bac3008e51423f6bbe7d3ecfd4b3cead0c6
Closes-Bug: 1644656

subject: Remove unused files
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-13 06:41:55.000000000', 'files': ['openstack-common.conf', 'MANIFEST.in'], 'message': 'Remove unused files

`MANIFEST.in` was used to handle git files but now pbr can do it instead.
`openstack-common.conf` was used to copy files from oslo-incubator, but
oslo-incubator is no longer maintained. So delete the two files from repo.

Change-Id: I976434e8283c588191d7bfb9321f46cea724406a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused files

`MANIFEST.in` was used to handle git files but now pbr can do it instead.
`openstack-common.conf` was used to copy files from oslo-incubator, but
oslo-incubator is no longer maintained. So delete the two files from repo.

Change-Id: I976434e8283c588191d7bfb9321f46cea724406a

commit_message:
add check-requirements to openstackclient meta package

the openstackclient meta package (contains all the supported
OSC plugins) needs a check-requirements job to be included
in requirements/project.txt (so we get proposal bot updates).

Change-Id: Ifcec74a25812192baa70c478e485a5bf916c4589

Override the DriverManager __init__ method to be able to
pass warn_on_missing_entrypoint=False to the
NamedExtensionManager so we don't mislead operators with
"Could not load" warning messages when plugins ultimately

commit_message:
Suppress annoying "Could not load" stevedore warnings

Override the DriverManager __init__ method to be able to
pass warn_on_missing_entrypoint=False to the
NamedExtensionManager so we don't mislead operators with
"Could not load" warning messages when plugins ultimately
load just fine by full class path.

Closes-Bug: #1649965
Change-Id: I52964905d12c0f35c86862ac04d2c6e13db80358

subject: Alter SQL Injection plugin SQL check
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-11 20:56:38.000000000', 'files': ['examples/sql_statements.py', 'bandit/plugins/injection_sql.py', 'tests/functional/test_functional.py'], 'message': 'Alter SQL Injection plugin SQL check

The previous version assumed the SQL query would start with `select`,
`insert into`, `update` or `delete from` which rules out queries that
are not so simple, for example queries using `with` such as:

   WITH cte AS (query)
   SELECT something FROM cte;

This version losens the criteria and considers any string with simple
SQL grammar (e.g. `select` followed by `from` anywhere within) as SQL.

Change-Id: I4c95842474e71aed61abc4bc878f3565a907f7c7
'}]
commit_message:
Alter SQL Injection plugin SQL check

The previous version assumed the SQL query would start with `select`,
`insert into`, `update` or `delete from` which rules out queries that
are not so simple, for example queries using `with` such as:

   WITH cte AS (query)
   SELECT something FROM cte;

This version losens the criteria and considers any string with simple
SQL grammar (e.g. `select` followed by `from` anywhere within) as SQL.

Change-Id: I4c95842474e71aed61abc4bc878f3565a907f7c7

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-13 01:13:37.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/slo.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_slo.py', 'test/functional/test_slo.py'], 'message': 'Fix download resumption for new SLOs.

SLOs created after commit 2d25fe6ad3573b2a06b6b3e5e66493d7b0c55693
have an explicit X-Object-Sysmeta-SLO-Size attribute. Fetching one of
those with a range like "bytes=100-" would crash and cause a 500. This
commit fixes the crash.

Closes-Bug: #1656147

Change-Id: I174ed98b4f01a5943af12177d6f8c3586f049778
'}]
commit_message:
Fix download resumption for new SLOs.

SLOs created after commit 2d25fe6ad3573b2a06b6b3e5e66493d7b0c55693
have an explicit X-Object-Sysmeta-SLO-Size attribute. Fetching one of
those with a range like "bytes=100-" would crash and cause a 500. This
commit fixes the crash.

Closes-Bug: #1656147

Change-Id: I174ed98b4f01a5943af12177d6f8c3586f049778

commit_message:
Relax conditions on neutron tasks rerun

Some of the changes in node configuration, e.g. controller
addition requires re-run of neutron tasks. This change
ensures that we rerun them on network_metadata changes

Change-Id: Iba4cae9794b5a0ec0ccf03390cbde9a122e9d5e0
Closes-bug: #1654203

subject: Allow not the same sequence in container_formats and disk_formats
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5689, 'name': 'Masayuki Igawa', 'email': 'masayuki@igawa.io', 'username': 'igawa'}, {'_account_id': 6167, 'name': "Ken'ichi Ohmichi", 'email': 'ken1ohmichi@gmail.com', 'username': 'oomichi'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Maan', 'email': 'gmaan@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 12017, 'name': 'DellEMC VNX CI', 'email': 'emc.vnx.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'emc-vnx-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20190, 'name': 'zhufl', 'email': 'zhu.fanglei@zte.com.cn', 'username': 'zhufl'}, {'_account_id': 23184, 'name': 'DavidPurcell', 'email': 'd.purcell222@gmail.com', 'username': 'DavidPurcell'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-01-09 01:33:25.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/image/v1/test_images.py'], 'message': 'Allow not the same sequence in container_formats and disk_formats

In glance v1, If container_format is one of ['ami', 'ari', 'aki'],
then disk_format must be same with container_format, otherwise
we will get an exception:
     "Invalid mix of disk and container formats. When setting a disk
      or container format to one of 'aki', 'ari', or 'ami', the
      container and disk formats must match."

And in tempest.conf, the container_format and disk_format may be of
different item sequence, such as:
    container_formats = ami,ari,aki,bare
    disk_formats = ari,ami,aki,vhd
In this case, the testcase may fail unexpectedly, so this is to
select one in disk_formats list that is same with container_format,
to avoid the unexpected failure.

Change-Id: Ia64e9ad70c78d8f26f117f90384756f78de164d8
'}]
commit_message:
Allow not the same sequence in container_formats and disk_formats

In glance v1, If container_format is one of ['ami', 'ari', 'aki'],
then disk_format must be same with container_format, otherwise
we will get an exception:
     "Invalid mix of disk and container formats. When setting a disk
      or container format to one of 'aki', 'ari', or 'ami', the
      container and disk formats must match."

And in tempest.conf, the container_format and disk_format may be of
different item sequence, such as:
    container_formats = ami,ari,aki,bare
    disk_formats = ari,ami,aki,vhd
In this case, the testcase may fail unexpectedly, so this is to
select one in disk_formats list that is same with container_format,
to avoid the unexpected failure.

Change-Id: Ia64e9ad70c78d8f26f117f90384756f78de164d8

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-11 22:55:07.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/glance/image.py', 'heat/tests/engine/test_resource_type.py'], 'message': 'Deprecate OS::Glance::Image

Since this resource type depends wholly on the deprecated Glance v1 API, we
should deprecate it as well. The Glance v2 API does not offer any
equivalent functionality.

Change-Id: Iab2bb291d1640f13b6f91957d795bdf4234fb0e5
Partially-Implements: blueprint migrate-to-glance-v2
'}]
commit_message:
Deprecate OS::Glance::Image

Since this resource type depends wholly on the deprecated Glance v1 API, we
should deprecate it as well. The Glance v2 API does not offer any
equivalent functionality.

Change-Id: Iab2bb291d1640f13b6f91957d795bdf4234fb0e5
Partially-Implements: blueprint migrate-to-glance-v2

commit_message:
Add the ability to check the tenant quota in detail

Now the quota-set API only returned single attribute
'limit', this change intends to add a new API
'quota-sets/{project_id}/detail' to retrieve more info
with attributes 'in_use', 'limit', 'reserved'.

APIImpact
Implements: blueprint admin-check-tenant-quota-usage
Depends-On: Ie0eb7d32b7b032ffdb7f7dd47f68841211e7d7a6
Change-Id: I499b099a3ba7704a2108cd15f80ff507e24b7cd0

commit_message:
Add OS::Neutron::Quota resource

This creates a new resource type whose intended use case is for admin-only
use to manage the Networking service quotas for projects.

implements bp neutron-quota-resource

Co-Authored-By: Julian Sy <julian.sy@att.com>

Change-Id: I968b67fcbdfc6b4ee7a953b92207181e5b257771

subject: Solve unexpected NoneType returned by _get_routers_can_schedule.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-11 02:07:45.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/scheduler/test_l3_agent_scheduler.py', 'neutron/scheduler/l3_agent_scheduler.py'], 'message': 'Solve unexpected NoneType returned by _get_routers_can_schedule.

Solve a problem with an unexpected NoneType returned by
_get_routers_can_schedule called from within
_schedule_ha_routers_to_additional_agent when using:

router_scheduler_driver =
    neutron.scheduler.l3_agent_scheduler.AZLeastRoutersScheduler

This was leading to problems with starting neutron-l3-agent on network
nodes, causing HA routers to fail to start.

Closes-Bug: #1641879
Related-Bug: #1654128
Change-Id: I33c5a6214670f0ada9c2293b0eb2ff243f6f7b1b
(cherry picked from commit 62176a9b40619327aacee9ed4162252d1245d019)
'}]
commit_message:
Solve unexpected NoneType returned by _get_routers_can_schedule.

Solve a problem with an unexpected NoneType returned by
_get_routers_can_schedule called from within
_schedule_ha_routers_to_additional_agent when using:

router_scheduler_driver =
    neutron.scheduler.l3_agent_scheduler.AZLeastRoutersScheduler

This was leading to problems with starting neutron-l3-agent on network
nodes, causing HA routers to fail to start.

Closes-Bug: #1641879
Related-Bug: #1654128
Change-Id: I33c5a6214670f0ada9c2293b0eb2ff243f6f7b1b
(cherry picked from commit 62176a9b40619327aacee9ed4162252d1245d019)

subject: Allow conditions in depends_on
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-11 10:36:53.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/template_common.py', 'heat/engine/hot/template.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'message': 'Allow conditions in depends_on

As resource can be conditionally defined, we need to be able to change
the dependency tree depending on which resources are present. This does
so by allowing condition functions in the depends_on resource section.

Change-Id: I6ef968090d9d099e3c1b8486c3ba930905f1da98
Closes-Bug: #1649900
'}]
commit_message:
Allow conditions in depends_on

As resource can be conditionally defined, we need to be able to change
the dependency tree depending on which resources are present. This does
so by allowing condition functions in the depends_on resource section.

Change-Id: I6ef968090d9d099e3c1b8486c3ba930905f1da98
Closes-Bug: #1649900

commit_message:
Make DHCP timeout configurable

As noted in the bug, there may be circumstances where a longer
timeout than the current default is needed.  This patch allows users
to tune this timeout for their environment if need be.

Change-Id: I173f3dad684894fbc3c27dece5ae15b5f63bae5a
Closes-Bug: 1654027

Centralize creation of security group test obj

The creation of security group objects are duplicated in several
places. This patch pretends to consolidate this in a single function
where it can be reused in the future.

subject: Check for l3 agents count before router update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-12 01:58:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': "Check for l3 agents count before router update

When updating a legacy router to be an HA, it's possible that there are
less than the minimum required l3 agents available. In this case an
exception will be raised to indicate this, but some of the changes will
already be in committed. The effect is that the router will be in an
invalid partial state between legacy and HA.

This patch simply checks that there are enough l3 agents before starting
to convert the router to HA. This adds a single DB query for each
router-update from legacy to HA, but saves a bunch of others in case the
transition should not take place.

Closes-Bug: #1609665
Change-Id: I566b17003f6d9b4c8205c0586f742795012da29c
(cherry picked from commit a167a3e20a755d599284ea10ebac5a8f1925e7ea)
"}]
commit_message:
Check for l3 agents count before router update

When updating a legacy router to be an HA, it's possible that there are
less than the minimum required l3 agents available. In this case an
exception will be raised to indicate this, but some of the changes will
already be in committed. The effect is that the router will be in an
invalid partial state between legacy and HA.

This patch simply checks that there are enough l3 agents before starting
to convert the router to HA. This adds a single DB query for each
router-update from legacy to HA, but saves a bunch of others in case the
transition should not take place.

Closes-Bug: #1609665
Change-Id: I566b17003f6d9b4c8205c0586f742795012da29c
(cherry picked from commit a167a3e20a755d599284ea10ebac5a8f1925e7ea)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3211, 'name': 'zhangjialong', 'email': 'zhangjl@awcloud.com', 'username': 'zhangjl'}, {'_account_id': 7118, 'name': 'Ian Wienand', 'email': 'iwienand@redhat.com', 'username': 'iwienand'}, {'_account_id': 10035, 'name': 'greghaynes', 'email': 'greg@greghaynes.net', 'username': 'greghaynes'}, {'_account_id': 12171, 'name': 'Moshe Levi', 'email': 'moshele@nvidia.com', 'username': 'moshele'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 12459, 'name': 'Stephanie Miller', 'email': 'stephane@alum.mit.edu', 'username': 'cinerama'}, {'_account_id': 13037, 'name': 'Amichay Polishuk', 'email': 'amichayp@mellanox.com', 'username': 'amichayp'}, {'_account_id': 16690, 'name': 'Noam Angel', 'email': 'noama@nvidia.com', 'username': 'noama'}, {'_account_id': 20835, 'name': 'Gerald Lonlas', 'email': 'glonlas@internap.com', 'username': 'glonlas'}, {'_account_id': 21909, 'name': 'Bob Fournier', 'email': 'bfournie@redhat.com', 'username': 'bfournie'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-12-06 06:44:45.000000000', 'files': ['elements/redhat-common/post-install.d/10-force-network-service', 'elements/redhat-common/environment.d/50-redhat-common', 'elements/redhat-common/README.rst'], 'message': 'redhat-common add option to select networking service NetworkManager/network

On "Red Hat" distro (fedora/rhel/centos) there are 2 networking services.
This patch adds an option to select which of the 2 option to enable and
the one not selected will be disabled.

I have tested the 3 rhel distros and on all of them both service was
running. This is not a bug, but not a good working environmnet, both service
are doing the same job and trying to run "dhclient" this can lead to
inconsistent results on production and testing enviroments.

usage:
set "DIB_FORCE_RH_NETWORK_SERVICE" to either 'network' or 'NetworkManager'.
The specified service will be enabled and the other service will be
disabled. If neither is set, no networking service will be enforced.

** To retain current status no defualt service is set. This probably mean
both service will be running.

Example: DIB_FORCE_RH_NETWORK_SERVICE=NetworkManager /
DIB_FORCE_RH_NETWORK_SERVICE=network

Change-Id: Ic5c6ebc193e5d89df9f58cfad76ad5f9bc484299
'}]
commit_message:
redhat-common add option to select networking service NetworkManager/network

On "Red Hat" distro (fedora/rhel/centos) there are 2 networking services.
This patch adds an option to select which of the 2 option to enable and
the one not selected will be disabled.

I have tested the 3 rhel distros and on all of them both service was
running. This is not a bug, but not a good working environmnet, both service
are doing the same job and trying to run "dhclient" this can lead to
inconsistent results on production and testing enviroments.

usage:
set "DIB_FORCE_RH_NETWORK_SERVICE" to either 'network' or 'NetworkManager'.
The specified service will be enabled and the other service will be
disabled. If neither is set, no networking service will be enforced.

** To retain current status no defualt service is set. This probably mean
both service will be running.

Example: DIB_FORCE_RH_NETWORK_SERVICE=NetworkManager /
DIB_FORCE_RH_NETWORK_SERVICE=network

Change-Id: Ic5c6ebc193e5d89df9f58cfad76ad5f9bc484299

Adds projects mapping to the mapping engine

  - enable lists to appear in the mapping rules
  - specifically pull out the projects to return

commit_message:
[CVE-2016-9590] Correct configuration file perms

The configuration files for the swift proxy and storage server were
getting their permissions changed from 0640 to 0644 due to the missing
mode on the concat resource for these files. This change defines the
permissions for these files to be 0640 to prevent unauthorized reading
of sensitive information that may be contained in these files.

Depends-On: Icb466a9662ae34eedeb3fb65bcb618775cb97d5d
Change-Id: I67385d3a3f17f8baec657cc7f85153f9ff31bee4

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-07 01:08:43.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_security_group.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py'], 'message': "Don't create default SG in transaction

Creating default security groups should not be done inside
another transaction because the creation code emits AFTER events.
Handlers for the push notification code expect to be able to read
from the DB during an after event using a new transaction, which will
not work if they are inside of exising transactions.

This patch adjusts the default security group creation logic to avoid
using layered transactions for the default security group creation and
adjusts ML2 to stop calling ensure_default_security_group inside of a
port/network transaction.

Change-Id: Iaa83c8664d5bfde31fdcdd694f6f18d9ef9bf14a

commit_message:
Don't create default SG in transaction

Creating default security groups should not be done inside
another transaction because the creation code emits AFTER events.
Handlers for the push notification code expect to be able to read
from the DB during an after event using a new transaction, which will
not work if they are inside of exising transactions.

This patch adjusts the default security group creation logic to avoid
using layered transactions for the default security group creation and
adjusts ML2 to stop calling ensure_default_security_group inside of a
port/network transaction.

Partially-Implements: blueprint push-notifications
Change-Id: Iaa83c8664d5bfde31fdcdd694f6f18d9ef9bf14a

commit_message:
Add UI Tests for Filtering Packages by Name/Type/Keyword.

Also made the following changes:
  - Added 4 new consts related to package filtering.
  - Added sec keyword to check_element_on_page to override default
    wait time.

    to make dynamically creating packages possible.

commit_message:
Allow python-memcache install from authtoken class

The python-memcache package is required if using memcached. By
default the package is not installed and the define has it set to
false. This change allows managing the python-memcache package
install from the authtoken class.

Change-Id: Ifd3fdea4c08fa9df451bcd4dc01f70b9a53f72c8

subject: Change storage worker default to ::os_workers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-11 09:32:13.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/storage/server.pp'], 'message': 'Change storage worker default to ::os_workers

This patch changes the default worker count from 1 to the ::os_workers fact.
::os_workers is based on the number of processors (currently cpu/4) but is
capped at a maximum of 8 worker processors.  This is a much more reasonable
default in general and prevents excessive resource consumption on systems with
a large number of CPUs.

This is a follow up to Ifa4f425091fae81204df68dd536f364efd647e3d

Related-Bug: 1655070
Change-Id: I29fd3d8930f32650549bfbf96478232075a7d0b9
'}]
commit_message:
Change storage worker default to ::os_workers

This patch changes the default worker count from 1 to the ::os_workers fact.
::os_workers is based on the number of processors (currently cpu/4) but is
capped at a maximum of 8 worker processors.  This is a much more reasonable
default in general and prevents excessive resource consumption on systems with
a large number of CPUs.

This is a follow up to Ifa4f425091fae81204df68dd536f364efd647e3d

Related-Bug: 1655070
Change-Id: I29fd3d8930f32650549bfbf96478232075a7d0b9

2. What is the solution to the problem
Remove az_hints which were obtained from the central neutron in
local plugin.

Closes-Bug: #1655583

commit_message:
Fail to boot vm in network with az-hint specified

1. What is the problem
Creates a network and specifies az-hint, then boot an instance in
this network, error occured in the neutron client: AvailabilityZone
could not be found.

2. What is the solution to the problem
Remove az_hints which were obtained from the central neutron in
local plugin.

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
No new features

Change-Id: I52f56a3fa0a4c642c20e70f4e842a2a5228fadfa
Closes-Bug: #1655583

commit_message:
Fix Swift statsd sample rate notes

These strings are not automatically updated by using
extract_swift_flags.py from openstack-doc-tools, because they are
empty by default. Therefore manually fixing these instead of removing
them.

This only affects only the following settings:

log_statsd_default_sample_rate
log_statsd_sample_rate_factor
access_log_statsd_default_sample_rate

Citing [1]: "The log_statsd_default_sample_rate should not be used and
remains for backward compatibility only."

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/swift/admin_guide.html#reporting-metrics-to-statsd

Closes-Bug: 1642502
Change-Id: I44f6a1826c2e2cfaed4275e6150e18e503ddfc7f

subject: Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-12-26 08:55:32.000000000', 'files': ['karbor/rpc.py'], 'message': 'Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher

Oslo messaging allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods
since 5.11.0 in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/358359/,
set with DefaultRPCAccessPolicy to fix FutureWarning like:

"The access_policy argument is changing its default
value to <class 'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.
DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'> in version '?',
please update the code to explicitly set None as the value:
access_policy defaults to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which
exposes private methods.Explicitly set access_policy to
DefaultRPCAccessPolicy or ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy.

Change-Id: Ic9a3122a02dd1e5c76b45c04801f4c9b3ce8a757
'}]
commit_message:
Set access_policy for messaging's dispatcher

Oslo messaging allow dispatcher to restrict endpoint methods
since 5.11.0 in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/358359/,
set with DefaultRPCAccessPolicy to fix FutureWarning like:

"The access_policy argument is changing its default
value to <class 'oslo_messaging.rpc.dispatcher.
DefaultRPCAccessPolicy'> in version '?',
please update the code to explicitly set None as the value:
access_policy defaults to LegacyRPCAccessPolicy which
exposes private methods.Explicitly set access_policy to
DefaultRPCAccessPolicy or ExplicitRPCAccessPolicy.

Change-Id: Ic9a3122a02dd1e5c76b45c04801f4c9b3ce8a757

The python-memcache package is required if using memcached. By
default the package is not installed and the define has it set to

subject: doc: Add a note about communicating exceptions to other teams
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-12 19:49:04.000000000', 'files': ['README.rst'], 'message': 'doc: Add a note about communicating exceptions to other teams

Nova caught a few projects off guard with the fact that cells v2
and the placement service are going to be required in Ocata and
to upgrade to Ocata, deployment tooling needs to be potentially
changed in Newton to allow the upgrade. Within our QA/CI system
we handle things like this using Grenade, but we as developers
sometimes forget to communicate these types of major changes
to the various deployment projects in OpenStack, like TripleO.
Developers have gotten used to assuming that everyone reads and
understands the implications of the release notes, and we need
reminders of how to effectively communicate beyond those. This
patch tries to help fill some of that reminder gap.

Change-Id: Ia654b88309a9d2506766e21309317ad14d47099a
'}]
commit_message:
doc: Add a note about communicating exceptions to other teams

Nova caught a few projects off guard with the fact that cells v2
and the placement service are going to be required in Ocata and
to upgrade to Ocata, deployment tooling needs to be potentially
changed in Newton to allow the upgrade. Within our QA/CI system
we handle things like this using Grenade, but we as developers
sometimes forget to communicate these types of major changes
to the various deployment projects in OpenStack, like TripleO.
Developers have gotten used to assuming that everyone reads and
understands the implications of the release notes, and we need
reminders of how to effectively communicate beyond those. This
patch tries to help fill some of that reminder gap.

Change-Id: Ia654b88309a9d2506766e21309317ad14d47099a

subject: Do not allow auth plugins to return different user_id
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-12 23:49:52.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_auth_plugin.py', 'keystone/auth/controllers.py'], 'message': 'Do not allow auth plugins to return different user_id

Do not allow the auth plugins to change the user id between the
different requested auth methods. If a plugin sets user_id in the
auth_context, all subsequent auth methods must set the same user_id
or Unauthorized is raised and an error logged. It is most likely
a configuration error with external auth method setting a different
user id. This is a hardening pass handling misconfigurations in a
more secure way.

Change-Id: I013846af59587d17b15ca4cf546e6372231f576e
Closes-Bug: #1656076
'}]
commit_message:
Do not allow auth plugins to return different user_id

Do not allow the auth plugins to change the user id between the
different requested auth methods. If a plugin sets user_id in the
auth_context, all subsequent auth methods must set the same user_id
or Unauthorized is raised and an error logged. It is most likely
a configuration error with external auth method setting a different
user id. This is a hardening pass handling misconfigurations in a
more secure way.

Change-Id: I013846af59587d17b15ca4cf546e6372231f576e
Closes-Bug: #1656076

commit_message:
Do not allow auth plugins to return different user_id

Do not allow the auth plugins to change the user id between the
different requested auth methods. If a plugin sets user_id in the
auth_context, all subsequent auth methods must set the same user_id
or Unauthorized is raised and an error logged. It is most likely
a configuration error with external auth method setting a different
user id. This is a hardening pass handling misconfigurations in a
more secure way.

Change-Id: I013846af59587d17b15ca4cf546e6372231f576e
Closes-Bug: #1656076

commit_message:
Refactor policy synchronizer

This commit adds the following

1. Move policy and rule synchronizer to new class from policy engine
2. support sync of single datasource policy
3. Expose synchronizer endpoints via PE to listen to broadcast requests for
   synchronization
4. update the functions to synchronize one policy instead looping through
   all policies everytime.

Partially-Implements blueprint refactor-synchronizer
Change-Id: I0fc4822daf6c49e6885471530a072caa03ce492b

subject: Add releasenotes and python35 jobs to Tricircle
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-11 03:54:29.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add releasenotes and python35 jobs to Tricircle

Currently no releasenotes and python35 jobs in Tricircle, the
releasenotes job is basic job to publish a release, and python35
is a common goal for the OpenStack community, so it's time
to add these jobs to Tricircle project.

At the same time, the xenial dvsm job is stable in Tricircle, it's
time to convert it to voting job.

Depends-On: I18cb59cadb7a1c06f6cd729c4bda2c8e95d41e1e

Change-Id: I20936840d0ea73f4b272172cedb0c6b759d6c0cc
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add releasenotes and python35 jobs to Tricircle

Currently no releasenotes and python35 jobs in Tricircle, the
releasenotes job is basic job to publish a release, and python35
is a common goal for the OpenStack community, so it's time
to add these jobs to Tricircle project.

At the same time, the xenial dvsm job is stable in Tricircle, it's
time to convert it to voting job.

Depends-On: I18cb59cadb7a1c06f6cd729c4bda2c8e95d41e1e

Change-Id: I20936840d0ea73f4b272172cedb0c6b759d6c0cc
Signed-off-by: joehuang <joehuang@huawei.com>

the context module during the enforcement of service and
admin rules, and as such an enforcer is needed. Incidentally
the enforcer is stored in a global variable whose name is the
same as the enforcer's used by neutron's policy engine.

To avoid confusion, this patch revises some parts of the

commit_message:
Revisit exported policy module

The primary goal of the library policy module is to support
the context module during the enforcement of service and
admin rules, and as such an enforcer is needed. Incidentally
the enforcer is stored in a global variable whose name is the
same as the enforcer's used by neutron's policy engine.

To avoid confusion, this patch revises some parts of the
library's policy module to make sure the cut of responsibilities
is better defined. It finally makes the policy module private
to avoid any danger of mixing up the enforcer instances.

Change-Id: Ie55d557aa3e24678aed2fb3b5c590485f54fe792

commit_message:
Allow python-memcache install from authtoken class

The python-memcache package is required if using memcached. By
default the package is not installed and the define has it set to
false. This change allows managing the python-memcache package
install from the authtoken class.

subject: Support last modified on listing containers
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'bloodeagle40234@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 6968, 'name': 'Christian Schwede', 'email': 'cschwede@redhat.com', 'username': 'cschwede'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 12279, 'name': 'Janie Richling', 'email': 'jrichli@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jrichli'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2017-01-12 18:09:49.000000000', 'files': ['swift/account/backend.py', 'test/unit/account/test_reaper.py', 'test/unit/account/test_server.py', 'api-ref/source/samples/account-containers-list-response.json', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'api-ref/source/samples/account-containers-list-response.xml', 'swift/account/utils.py', 'swift/account/reaper.py', 'test/unit/account/test_backend.py', 'test/functional/swift_test_client.py'], 'message': 'Support last modified on listing containers

For now, last modified timestamp is supported only on
object listing. (i.e. GET container)

For example:

GET container with json format results in like as:

[{"hash": "d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e", "last_modified":
"2015-06-10T04:58:23.460230", "bytes": 0, "name": "object",
"content_type": "application/octet-stream"}]

However, container listing (i.e. GET account) shows just a dict
consists of ("name", "bytes", "name") for each container.

For example:

GET accounts with json format result in like as:

[{"count": 0, "bytes": 0, "name": "container"}]

This patch is for supporting last_modified key in the container
listing results as well as object listing like as:

[{"count": 0, "bytes": 0, "name": "container", "last_modified":
"2015-06-10T04:58:23.460230"}]

This patch is changing just output for listing. The original
timestamp to show the last modified is already in container table
of account.db as a "put_timestamp" column.

Note that this patch *DOESN'T* change the put_timestamp semantics.
i.e. the last_modified timestamp will be changed only at both PUT
container and POST container.
(PUT object doesn't affect the timestamp)

Note that the tuple format of returning value from
swift.account.backend.AccountBroker.list_containers is now
(name, object_count, bytes_used, put_timestamp, 0)

* put_timestamp is added *

Original discussion was in working session at Vancouver Summit.
Etherpads are around here:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-swift-contributors-meetup
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-container-listing-update

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iba0503916f1481a20c59ae9136436f40183e4c5b
'}]
commit_message:
Support last modified on listing containers

For now, last modified timestamp is supported only on
object listing. (i.e. GET container)

For example:

GET container with json format results in like as:

[{"hash": "d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e", "last_modified":
"2015-06-10T04:58:23.460230", "bytes": 0, "name": "object",
"content_type": "application/octet-stream"}]

However, container listing (i.e. GET account) shows just a dict
consists of ("name", "bytes", "name") for each container.

For example:

GET accounts with json format result in like as:

[{"count": 0, "bytes": 0, "name": "container"}]

This patch is for supporting last_modified key in the container
listing results as well as object listing like as:

[{"count": 0, "bytes": 0, "name": "container", "last_modified":
"2015-06-10T04:58:23.460230"}]

This patch is changing just output for listing. The original
timestamp to show the last modified is already in container table
of account.db as a "put_timestamp" column.

Note that this patch *DOESN'T* change the put_timestamp semantics.
i.e. the last_modified timestamp will be changed only at both PUT
container and POST container.
(PUT object doesn't affect the timestamp)

Note that the tuple format of returning value from
swift.account.backend.AccountBroker.list_containers is now
(name, object_count, bytes_used, put_timestamp, 0)

* put_timestamp is added *

Original discussion was in working session at Vancouver Summit.
Etherpads are around here:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-swift-contributors-meetup
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/liberty-container-listing-update

DocImpact

Change-Id: Iba0503916f1481a20c59ae9136436f40183e4c5b

commit_message:
Allow to pass suite flavor to gate_hook to disable dvr tests

Now if a job explicitly passes 'dvrskip' as a second argument to
gate_hook, then those tests requiring dvr extension won't be executed.

Needed-By: I0e94c5d7f65bbb1d803df0d2f99389ae19556480
Change-Id: I05233e69801be27cc35211148a53af02af29c8a5

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-01-12 22:10:37.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/bug-1655537-20b0eb676afa278f.yaml', 'openstackclient/common/quota.py'], 'message': 'Fix quota show output

Currently Quota Show expects dictionary to be returned
for Network client, similar to Volume and Compute clients, but

to fail.
This patch takes care of this issue.

commit_message:
Fix quota show output

Currently Quota Show expects dictionary to be returned
for Network client, similar to Volume and Compute clients, but
Network Object is being returned, causing the "openstack quota show"
to fail.
This patch takes care of this issue.

Depends-On: Ie0e045ff4888615d68804fd739d5b995ca11e9a1
Change-Id: Ic507997cba09fcfa84dd1151d6922f56a7c5187b
Closes-Bug:#1655537

commit_message:
Fix list metric for other tenants

1. Use get_x_tenant_or_tenant_id instead of get_tenant_id in list
metrics api.
2. Add missing delegateAuthorizedRole config to devstack api-config.yml

Change-Id: I18c0dd340a4ac8b016e761d648d9f03923b070bc
Closes-bug: #1613997

This change try to fix this problem.

commit_message:
Fix exception for multiple devices with same label

This fixes the exception message that is raised when there are
multiple devices with the same label. Instead of including the
original device path, it was showing one of the device's name
& label.

The message now includes the original device path along with
the two devices that have the same label.

Change-Id: Id114b25e95492686bc6679e217d4963d6a3ed0c4
Related-Bug: #1654269

commit_message:
Pin beaker-puppet_install_helper to 0.5.0

beaker-puppet_install_helper 0.6.0 included the switch to puppet agent
by default since the EOL of puppet3. Since Mitaka has some modules that
don't support puppet4 (I'm looking at you puppet-swift), we need to pin
it.

Change-Id: Icb466a9662ae34eedeb3fb65bcb618775cb97d5d

under puppet 4. Since puppet 3 is now officially EOL, this switches the
defaut to assume puppet agent packaging rather than the foss version.

Change-Id: I3243f9d7bdb19840f6462c5b6b237c2314a71fbe
(cherry picked from commit 6d5803d05a6e308e3c315c2689f1cec031d21fad)

commit_message:
Fix beaker under centos

beaker-puppet_install_helper 0.6.0 has made the PUPPET_INSTALL_TYPE now
default to agent which was the previous behavior we had when running
under puppet 4. Since puppet 3 is now officially EOL, this switches the
defaut to assume puppet agent packaging rather than the foss version.

Change-Id: I3243f9d7bdb19840f6462c5b6b237c2314a71fbe
(cherry picked from commit 6d5803d05a6e308e3c315c2689f1cec031d21fad)

commit_message:
Update Python classifiers

Project which supports python 3 should specify it using just major version and
then for every subversion should specify it. Remove also 3.4 classifier as
OpenStack decided about dropping support for this release completely.

Change-Id: I9beb6ef2df4c96f2f92e4f75e900f16eae9e325b

commit_message:
unskip network qos rule type functional test

with the SDK at 0.9.12 the below test fails with:

'minimum_bandwidth' not in

+-----------------+
| Type            |
+-----------------+
| dscp_marking    |
| bandwidth_limit |
+-----------------+

So remove 'minimum_bandwidth' from the asserted fields.

Change-Id: I24ff691ae5a946d901afa763973305025829280b
Closes-Bug: 1653137

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2017-01-12 10:37:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_router_availability_zone.py', 'neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_dvr_db.py', 'neutron/db/availability_zone/router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py', 'neutron/db/l3_attrs_db.py'], 'message': 'Decompose router extra attr processing

This adjusts the extra router attributes mixin to add
a new function to explicitly set the value of an extra
attribute. The mixins that depend on extra attrs
now explicitly call this instead of depending on a big
inheritance chain of calling _process_extra_attr_router_create.

This will allow the router_az, DVR and HA modules to eventually
be separated from the L3 plugin class inheritance entirely.

Related: blueprint multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: If44bfef9428f43dd82758928bf46786b70e5e11c
'}]
commit_message:
Decompose router extra attr processing

This adjusts the extra router attributes mixin to add
a new function to explicitly set the value of an extra
attribute. The mixins that depend on extra attrs
now explicitly call this instead of depending on a big
inheritance chain of calling _process_extra_attr_router_create.

This will allow the router_az, DVR and HA modules to eventually
be separated from the L3 plugin class inheritance entirely.

Related: blueprint multi-l3-backends
Change-Id: If44bfef9428f43dd82758928bf46786b70e5e11c

subject: Fix Gentoo builds on Ubuntu 16.04 Xenial hosts
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-01-10 16:34:36.000000000', 'files': ['elements/gentoo/bin/install-packages'], 'message': "Fix Gentoo builds on Ubuntu 16.04 Xenial hosts

Xenial's bind of /dev into the chroot includes /dev/shm which is in
use by the host.  An alternitive fix for this would be to use rbind
to recursivly bind mount /dev instead of just the base bind of /dev

Change-Id: I2c0f70afd1e82dd52a522f0dd2b3ea618b30b6c6
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Gentoo builds on Ubuntu 16.04 Xenial hosts

Xenial's bind of /dev into the chroot includes /dev/shm which is in
use by the host.  An alternitive fix for this would be to use rbind
to recursivly bind mount /dev instead of just the base bind of /dev

Change-Id: I2c0f70afd1e82dd52a522f0dd2b3ea618b30b6c6

The typo meant that the intended non global config was not being
used, and instead the config was loaded in the normal way. This
worked because the config loaded by the project name is the same
as the config loaded otherwise.

There's no test coverage of this in unit and functional tests
because the NoAuthMiddleware is always used based on overridden
configuration. The gate tests that turn on placement will exercise
this code.

Change-Id: I9f1b8905fd9d5aadac61718e24c76b1b2f80410d
Closes-Bug: #1645306
"}]
commit_message:
[placement] fix typo in call to create auth middleware

The typo meant that the intended non global config was not being
used, and instead the config was loaded in the normal way. This
worked because the config loaded by the project name is the same
as the config loaded otherwise.

There's no test coverage of this in unit and functional tests
because the NoAuthMiddleware is always used based on overridden
configuration. The gate tests that turn on placement will exercise
this code.

Change-Id: I9f1b8905fd9d5aadac61718e24c76b1b2f80410d
Closes-Bug: #1645306

subject: Allow suppression of warnings from DriverManager
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 18:25:48.000000000', 'files': ['stevedore/driver.py'], 'message': 'Allow suppression of warnings from DriverManager

Some projects (e.g. Neutron) using the DriverManager with
another fallback mechanism when the alias doesn't exist don't
want the "Could not load warning" messages in the logs.

This patch allows the warn_on_missing_entrypoint kwarg to be
passed to DriverManager which passes it up to its parent
NamedExtensionManager.

Change-Id: Ia6f5f749fc2f73ca6091fa6d58506fddb058902a
'}]
commit_message:
Allow suppression of warnings from DriverManager

Some projects (e.g. Neutron) using the DriverManager with
another fallback mechanism when the alias doesn't exist don't
want the "Could not load warning" messages in the logs.

This patch allows the warn_on_missing_entrypoint kwarg to be
passed to DriverManager which passes it up to its parent
NamedExtensionManager.

Change-Id: Ia6f5f749fc2f73ca6091fa6d58506fddb058902a

commit_message:

Some BGP driver is agentless, but the neutron-dynamic-routing is
bound to RPC driver so closely. So the codes need to be refactored.

commit_message:
Use parameter skip_op_id in compute.virt.vmware.test_vsphere_operations

oslo.vmware began to use key-workd paramerter skip_op_id in method
vim.RetrievePropertiesEx in 6a63362919c12023798458e721a4818e61702e3a,
which broke job periodic-ceilometer-py27-with-oslo-master[1], so add
parameter skip_op_id in ceilometer's tests to avoid failure in the
future.

[1]http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/periodic-ceilometer-py27-with-oslo-master/327f794/testr_results.html.gz

Change-Id: I0d25f94136568f4d77928f12e0ba430118827fdb

commit_message:
mech driver v2: build dict for sg on update

precommit callback for security group precommit doesn't pass
complete information. So build it in callback as bug work around.
precoomit callback should be passed full information.
Once it's fixed, this bug work around should be removed.
The original bug report[1] is filed for ODL, but it turned out
the issue resides in neutron and networking-odl

[1] https://bugs.opendaylight.org/show_bug.cgi?id=7256

Change-Id: I15b6f5321cd3e860de7ba50dd5dde8672259c9ba
Related-bug: #1546910
(cherry picked from commit 194da19e84ddabaa2237bd8f971ac331298e3620)

subject: tripleo-quickstart: Alter default -extras req file to use zuul fetched repo
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-24 20:33:00.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/tripleo.yaml'], 'message': 'tripleo-quickstart: Alter default -extras req file to use zuul fetched repo

tripleo-quickstart uses tripleo-quickstart-extras by installing it into
a virtualenv it creates, issuing a pip install -r requirements.txt .
The requirements file contains a reference to the git repository. When
quickstart-extras is instead fetched by zuul cloner, we need to specify
a local reference to be installed in the process.
The simplest way is to patch the requirements file on the fly, changing
the git: part with a file: part containing the absolute path to the zuul
fetched repo.

Change-Id: I4ce2cf278e5307484d32ac5dc3845534a9731712
'}]
commit_message:
tripleo-quickstart: Alter default -extras req file to use zuul fetched repo

tripleo-quickstart uses tripleo-quickstart-extras by installing it into
a virtualenv it creates, issuing a pip install -r requirements.txt .
The requirements file contains a reference to the git repository. When
quickstart-extras is instead fetched by zuul cloner, we need to specify
a local reference to be installed in the process.
The simplest way is to patch the requirements file on the fly, changing
the git: part with a file: part containing the absolute path to the zuul
fetched repo.

Change-Id: I4ce2cf278e5307484d32ac5dc3845534a9731712

commit_message:
Add caching to get_nailgun_node_by_devops_node

Instead of calling list_nodes() and get_node_interfaces(node['id']) for each
node in returned list cache devops node id to nailgun node id mapping and
use get_node_by_id instead. As a result there will be less logs in
sys_test.log and it will be easier to read them as
get_nailgun_node_by_devops_node is used quite extensively.

Change-Id: Ied8230c65d795104dffca80ee26514909afc80e5
Closes-Bug: 1656037

subject: Automatically convert process_input to bytes
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-01-12 19:07:35.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_concurrency/processutils.py', 'oslo_concurrency/tests/unit/test_processutils.py'], 'message': "Automatically convert process_input to bytes

On py35, if process_input is a string we end with an Error:
TypeError: memoryview: a bytes-like object is required, not 'str'

A whole lot of code in os-brick/cinder/neutron currently need
to be fixed. Hardest problem is tracking down every instance of
this problem and trying to test/fix it at source. See example
of cinder/os-brick/oslo.rootwrap/oslo.privep code problem here:
http://logs.openstack.org/43/418643/2/check/gate-rally-dsvm-py35-cinder-nv/6efa7b5/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=ERROR

It's just better to fix it in one spot and pass the correct
thing to subprocess.communicate

Change-Id: I88d1510a7ba4c020f73452f0b80e996c22b1edf1
"}]
commit_message:
Automatically convert process_input to bytes

On py35, if process_input is a string we end with an Error:
TypeError: memoryview: a bytes-like object is required, not 'str'

A whole lot of code in os-brick/cinder/neutron currently need
to be fixed. Hardest problem is tracking down every instance of
this problem and trying to test/fix it at source. See example
of cinder/os-brick/oslo.rootwrap/oslo.privep code problem here:
http://logs.openstack.org/43/418643/2/check/gate-rally-dsvm-py35-cinder-nv/6efa7b5/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=ERROR

It's just better to fix it in one spot and pass the correct
thing to subprocess.communicate

Change-Id: I88d1510a7ba4c020f73452f0b80e996c22b1edf1

commit_message:
Add dummy API definitions for extension subresources

This change introduces the dummy definitions for extension
subresources, and its related testing coverage. It was
observed in a few definition proposals (e.g. [1]) that this
was a missing element in the description of a neutron extension.

The enhancement got reflected in the existing definitions, such
as trunk and trunk_details, and thus amends were made to these
to show how to use the dummy suggestions in practice.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/413182

Change-Id: I5eb36cdf99039f2e74c93735fcddd5953c7fe086

commit_message:
A script that pulls the latest puppet source

A script to download the latest puppet modules from source.
This works well with the upload-puppet-modules script.
There are options to pull the latest source or skip
an update if the module already exists.

Author: Wes Hayutin <weshayutin@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Martin Andre <m.andre@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I5ee8ec1e54f02c7b39331a56b9bcc36d5a1055f2

subject: Stop running if zuul job goes away
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-01-10 23:14:19.000000000', 'files': ['toci_gate_test.sh'], 'message': "Stop running if zuul job goes away

At times we are ending up with significantly more testenvs running
than we have zuul jobs.  The current theory is that this happens
when a zuul job is removed before completion, possibly when a new
patch set is pushed or a change is abandoned.  Because our test
jobs are unaware of zuul they continue to run even though infra
thinks the job has been stopped.  This can cause us to exceed the
quota for the nodepool user.

This patch attempts to deal with the problem by periodically
querying the zuul status endpoint and looking for the ZUUL_UUID
value in the output.  If it's not found the job will be killed.

Change-Id: I31a8157366a6ec91d8a0befeadc51eca8d8225e1
Closes-Bug: 1655489
"}]
commit_message:
Stop running if zuul job goes away

At times we are ending up with significantly more testenvs running
than we have zuul jobs.  The current theory is that this happens
when a zuul job is removed before completion, possibly when a new
patch set is pushed or a change is abandoned.  Because our test
jobs are unaware of zuul they continue to run even though infra
thinks the job has been stopped.  This can cause us to exceed the
quota for the nodepool user.

This patch attempts to deal with the problem by periodically
querying the zuul status endpoint and looking for the ZUUL_UUID
value in the output.  If it's not found the job will be killed.

Change-Id: I31a8157366a6ec91d8a0befeadc51eca8d8225e1
Closes-Bug: 1655489

commit_message:
Relax conditions on neutron tasks rerun

Some of the changes in node configuration, e.g. controller
addition requires re-run of neutron tasks. This change
ensures that we rerun them on network_metadata changes

Change-Id: Iba4cae9794b5a0ec0ccf03390cbde9a122e9d5e0
Closes-bug: #1654203

commit_message:
Implement thread pool for network verification

By default network checker runs ping to every ip
in a thread simultaneously, depending on HW packets
lost is possible, parallel_amount allows to configure
how many pings should be run in parallel.

Also add constraint on amount of connectivity checker
tasks.

Change-Id: I3aec37a2f50470cf905bccac34a6f79d2d5065d0
Closes-bug: #1653301

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-01-09 19:12:25.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/odl-releases/common', 'devstack/plugin.sh'], 'message': 'devstack: improve odl-release definition

This patch improves odl release definitions.
Odl release definition is mostly trivial and it can be generated
based on its release name for most common cases.
Generate necessary parameters for odl releases if they are missing
so that future unknown releases can be handled without modification.

Change-Id: I56b559254948935554125b1175995e0d85a9401b
(cherry picked from commit d8e2ec52256b61d7f2b31f6513286c87d60ff286)
'}]
commit_message:
devstack: improve odl-release definition

This patch improves odl release definitions.
Odl release definition is mostly trivial and it can be generated
based on its release name for most common cases.
Generate necessary parameters for odl releases if they are missing
so that future unknown releases can be handled without modification.

Change-Id: I56b559254948935554125b1175995e0d85a9401b
(cherry picked from commit d8e2ec52256b61d7f2b31f6513286c87d60ff286)

commit_message:
Return uuid attribute for aggregates

Adds a Compute API microversion that triggers returning an aggregate's UUID
field. This field is necessary for scripts that must populate the placement API
with resource provider to aggregate relationships, which rely on UUIDs for
global identification.

APIImpact
blueprint: return-uuid-from-os-aggregates-api
Change-Id: I4112ccd508eb85403933fec8b52efd468e866772
Closes-bug: #1652642

revisions:
[{'number': 44, 'created': '2017-01-11 12:11:58.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/objects/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_node_collection_handlers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/api/v1/validators/node.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/base.py'], 'message': 'Change node search and validation methods

- Remove searches by any MAC
- Add search by system uuid
- Allow duplicate MACs (except "mac" property)

The previous implementation used a fallback matching rule which
would match a node if any of its MACs are found in the database.
This is not reliable because MACs can sometimes be identical due to
hardware specifics or other reasons.

This change removes matching by any MAC with matching by system uuid,
which is reliably unique for both hardware and virtual systems,
and also constant for a given system unless it's motherboard is
replaced.

This change allows nodes to have identical MACs on iterfaces.
However, "mac" property still has to be unique.

User is responsible for ensuring that interfaces with identical MACs
(if any) are not assigned to the same networks, which will obviously
lead to deployment & connectivity issues.

This change adds a randomly generated system uuid to the default_metadata
in tests.

Closes-Bug: 1650646
Change-Id: I49855e2b5ff30559cb2385a03abb8cfdd6a5f1f2
'}]
commit_message:
Change node search and validation methods

- Remove searches by any MAC
- Add search by system uuid
- Allow duplicate MACs (except "mac" property)

The previous implementation used a fallback matching rule which
would match a node if any of its MACs are found in the database.
This is not reliable because MACs can sometimes be identical due to
hardware specifics or other reasons.

This change removes matching by any MAC with matching by system uuid,
which is reliably unique for both hardware and virtual systems,
and also constant for a given system unless it's motherboard is
replaced.

This change allows nodes to have identical MACs on iterfaces.
However, "mac" property still has to be unique.

User is responsible for ensuring that interfaces with identical MACs
(if any) are not assigned to the same networks, which will obviously
lead to deployment & connectivity issues.

This change adds a randomly generated system uuid to the default_metadata
in tests.

Closes-Bug: 1650646
Change-Id: I49855e2b5ff30559cb2385a03abb8cfdd6a5f1f2

Enable IPA client install

The puppet-ipaclient package is available in delorean.
Therefore, we can enable the requires directive that will
perform the ipa-client-install.
